intro: Parnassia laxmannii, commonly known as the slender white crowfoot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately divided, with five to seven leaflets that are hairy and pointed. Parnassia laxmannii is often found in the northern hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America.
